definition: to sweep along/to coerce
to bind/to wrap/a bundle/a parcel
to clasp under the arm/to coerce
old variant of 夾|夹[jia1]

sentences.english: Gusting winds sent ground storms of feathers scurrying seaward.
sentences.chinese: 阵风席卷而过，裹挟地面的羽毛，扑向海面。

sentences.english: In short winter storms are likely to become stronger and more frequent, with stronger winds.
sentences.chinese: 短暂的冬季里，裹挟着大风的暴雪会更加强烈和频繁。

sentences.english: Originally true appearance is descended all by the sediment of the ages big tide bind to ride on to drift everywhere.
sentences.chinese: 本真状态，被泥沙俱下的时代大潮裹挟着四处漂流。

definition: to compel/to coerce
a powerful current/a flood (often fig., e.g. a flood of ideas)
to wrap up/(fig.) to envelop/to swallow up
to carry within it/to be mixed in/to slip sth in/to intersperse/(hydrology etc) to entrain/to smuggle/notes smuggled into an exam
to surge up violently (of ocean, river, lake etc)/turbulent
to engulf/to sweep/to carry away everything
to mix together (disparate substances)/to mingle/a mix/to be tangled up with
to be full of/to flood/to congest
spring tide/(fig.) momentous social change
lit. hiding the sky and covering the earth (idiom); fig. earth-shattering/omnipresent/of universal importance
to submerge/to drown/to flood/to drown out (also fig.)
to flock (to see)/to mill/to throng
to press (for a payment)
to mix/to stir
to whistle/to scream/to whiz
turbid flow/muddy waters/fig. a contemptible person/fig. corrupt or disgraceful social trends
